title: Saving your Recordings??
body:
So I use LoLReplay2 to record my games, works a treat can view them all back in spectator mode etc etc.

But how do I convert them to an editable format? I've tried 2 different programs that record the screen when I watch the replays back, but it records a black screen and the audio quality is terrible.

What does everyone else use for this?

replies.body: Thanks for the tips everyone, will suss it all out tonight

OBS can be used to stream and record locally to your hard drive.

I use after effects for rendering and stuff, but you might need to look into another program.

you'll need an external program to save replays and it only works by recording an mp4 of your screen whilst watching the replay. Windows 10 has an inbuilt screen capture program or you can download something like ezvid.

If you aren't trying to upload to youtube, there are other methods of storing the replay as a command code that will force spectate in delay, replay.gg has a service like this but like most other methods of recording the entire game in spectate mode, it won't work across patches.
Open Broadcaster Software is the best.
Is this for uploading only? Or can you save locally?

> [{quoted}](name=Sloth Almighty,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=P2yl0p4l,comment-id=00000000,timestamp=2016-08-28T01:47:19.551+0000)
>
> Is this for uploading only? Or can you save locally?

You record the recordings with OBS and it'll save locally. Be sure that you don't save them as a lossless file, else you'll have 300gb videos.
